locutie.beschrijving: The sermon explores the theme of Advent as a season of waiting and watching, using historical and contemporary analogies (D-Day, 2000 Election, Civil Rights) to illustrate the 'armor of light' as active non-violence and faithful presence.
locutie.exegetische_kwaliteit: Moderate. The exegesis is largely topical and illustrative, using Bonhoeffer and biblical snippets to support a theme of 'passive-active' waiting.

illocutie.beschrijving: The primary force is Assertive (describing what Advent is) and Expressive (sharing personal anecdotes), with a late shift toward Commissive/Declarative in the conclusion.
voorbeelden: Advent is the season in which we wait...
I think you can feel the urgency...
He who began a good work in you will carry it on...

perlocutie.beoogd_effect: To encourage the congregation to remain faithful in 'small' acts of service and to trust in God's future action.
perlocutie.pneumatologisch_bewustzijn: Moderate. Mention of Marie Rentall as a 'Spirit-filled reader' and the Word as 'living and active'.

voorbeelden: Advent is the season...
The city of New Orleans has a new museum.
The early church made a mistake (it is said).
Watch therefore.
Let us then cast off the works of darkness.
Put on the whole armor of God.
I'm struck by all the little things.
I have been waiting many years to tell the story.
It was one of the most wonderful experiences.
He will carry it on to completion.
God will act definitively in the future.
They shall share alike.
commissieven.kwaliteit: Strongly grounded in scripture but often framed as a future-tense description rather than a direct 'I promise you' address.

voorbeelden: You are already wearing a piece of the armor of light.
I am giving it [the verse] to you.
It gives life to you.
declaratieven.autoriteit: High in the conclusion; the preacher moves from 'talking about' to 'bestowing' the identity of the armor-bearer upon the congregation.

indicatoren: Extensive historical anecdotes (D-Day, Election 2000) that function as analogies rather than proclamations.
Long sections describing what 'theologians say' or 'commentators suggest'.
constatief_surplus_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: The hearer becomes an observer of interesting stories and theological concepts rather than a participant in a divine event until the very end.

missende_elementen: Present-tense sacramental address in the body of the sermon
performatief_deficit_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: Delayed encounter; the 'event' only happens in the final three paragraphs.

toezegging_check.kwaliteit_toezeggen: High theological quality, specifically the use of Phil 1:6 as a promise of God's perseverance.
voorbeelden: He who began a good work in you will carry it on to completion.

tweede_persoon.gebruik: Direct address concentrated in the conclusion.
tweede_persoon.performatieve_context: Used to declare the congregation's current status in God's campaign.

derde_persoon.gebruik: Describing historical figures, political situations, and theological definitions.
derde_persoon.distantie_effect: Creates a 'lecture' feel for the first 70% of the text.

verleden_tijd.gebruik: Extensive use of historical examples (Bonhoeffer, Civil Rights, personal memories).

actueel_present.gebruik: The 'now' of the congregation in Hartford.

sacramenteel_patroon.beschrijving: The sermon moves from the indicative of God's coming (Assertive) to the declaration of the hearer's participation (Declarative) and finally to the promise of completion (Commissive).
voorbeelden: God begins good works... (Assertive) -> You are already wearing... (Declarative) -> He will carry it on... (Commissive)
sacramenteel_patroon.kwaliteit: The pattern is present but heavily weighted toward the end, making the 'event' feel like a conclusion rather than the substance.

voorbeelden_goede_verhouding: Because salvation is near (Indicative), let us cast off darkness (Imperative).

diagnostische_evaluatie.diagnose_toelichting: The sermon functions primarily to provide comfort and identity through the promise of God's sustaining grace, though it spends significant time in informative/illustrative mode.

sterke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: He who began a good work in you will carry it on.
sterke_punten.effect: Provides a solid foundation for faith beyond human effort.

zwakke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: The long section on the 2000 election and bumper stickers.
zwakke_punten.probleem: Theological point is buried under social commentary.

diagnostische_evaluatie.gebeuren_toelichting: The final address to 'Beloved people of Trinity Church' shifts the sermon from a talk about light to an act of vesting the congregation in that light.
diagnostische_evaluatie.sacramentele_toelichting: The preacher successfully uses the Word to 'give life' in the final moments.

openbaringsleer.god_als_spreker: Implicitly, through the 'living and active' Word.
openbaringsleer.prediker_als_mandataris: Yes, specifically when giving the Bible verse to the congregation.
tekstueel_bewijs: I am giving it to you... It gives life to you.

pneumatologie.geest_rol_erkend: Yes, through the mention of the 'Spirit-filled reader'.
pneumatologie.perlocutie_theologie: Yes, the preacher trusts the Word to 'give life'.

sacramentstheologie.preek_als_genademiddel: Yes, the sermon is treated as a means of conveying the 'armor'.
tekstueel_bewijs: You are already participating in the Lordâ€™s campaign.

aanbevelingen.werkwoord_audit_samenvatting: The sermon relies heavily on 'is' and 'was'. Increasing 'I declare' or 'God promises' would strengthen the event-character.

specifieke_suggesties.huidige_formulering: Advent is the season in which we wait.
specifieke_suggesties.voorgestelde_revisie: In this Advent hour, God calls you to wait.
specifieke_suggesties.verschil: Shifts from a definition to a direct call/address.

toezegging_versterking.probleem: The toezegging is strong but late.
toezegging_versterking.suggestie: Interweave the promise of Phil 1:6 throughout the illustrations.
voorbeeldzinnen: Even in your waiting, God is completing His work in you.

adressering_verbetering.suggestie: Use 'you' more frequently when applying the historical examples.
voorbeeldzinnen: Like the watchman, you are standing on the height.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A homiletically rich sermon that successfully transitions from information to proclamation, though the journey through the 'constative' forest is somewhat long.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_schulz_von_thun: SAT focuses on the preacher's authority to declare reality (Armor of Light) rather than just the psychological appeal to the listener's 'ear'.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retoriek: The power here is not in the cleverness of the 'eracism' story, but in the illocutionary force of the biblical promise.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_SAT: SAT reveals that the sermon's 'event' status is saved by the shift to Declaratives in the final three paragraphs.

kernzinnen_analyse.zin: You are already wearing a piece of the armor of light.
kernzinnen_analyse.effectiviteit: Excellent; it changes the hearer's self-perception.

appendices.notities: The sermon is a classic example of 'saving the performative for the end'.
